model.BoardPack

Class DynamicBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.BoardPack.Board
      • model.BoardPack.DynamicBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DynamicBoard
extends Board
implements java.io.Serializable
    DynamicBoard uses the expandable boardArray as the board. The DynamicBoard-class differs from the StaticBoard-class in the way cells located at the row-borders and at the column-borders are processed. Instead of having a zero-row and a zero-column wrapped around the board, the DynamicBoard expands dynamically by adding rows and columns in the needed direction.
    See Also:
    Board, Serialized Form

      • DynamicBoard

        public DynamicBoard()
        Board constructors. Which uses set values, or rows and colums parameters or copies and converts a array consisting of 0's and 1's; Handles outer column and outer row of the arrays by adding two extra rows and columns consisting of 0's.

      • getBoundingBox

        public int[] getBoundingBox()
        The getBoundingBox is a method which collects the outer sizes of an 2D array where there are active elements. So that an array with large white spaces can be compressed to fit exactly to the active elements. boundingBox[4] // minrow maxrow mincolumn maxcolumn Reference "oppgavesett 5".
        Specified by:
        getBoundingBox in class Board
        Returns:
        an array witch describes where the active rows and columns start and end.

      • addArrayToBoard

        public void addArrayToBoard(byte[][] array)
        Adds a byte[][] to the boardArray at the position decided by the placement variables. The placement variables, placementy and placementx are determined by the placement from the user (ymove and xmove) and the boardArray relative to the array that is to be placed onto the boardArray. If the array is placed outside the boundaries of the boardArray, rows and columns are added to compensate for this.
        Specified by:
        addArrayToBoard in class Board
        Parameters:
        array - the byte[][] to be placed onto the boardArray
        See Also:
        addRows(int, boolean), addColumns(int, boolean), the existing board, changed to false if it previously existed a topBoard to be placed

      • addRowsandColumns

        public void addRowsandColumns()
        Adds rows and columns to the board as it grows bigger. Creates a num number of rows, create them of the same length as the boardList.get(0) and places the rows either at index 0 (if top is true) or at the end of the boardList if top is false.
        See Also:
        - adds int number of rows at the top of the boardArray if the boolean is true, - adds int number of columns at the left side of the boardArray if the boolean is true, - adjusts the index address for the rows according to how the indexes have been changed when rows have been added, - adjusts the index address for the columns according to how the indexes have been changed when columns have been added

      • addColumns

        public void addColumns(int addColumns,
                       boolean left)
        Add columns that expands the boardArray horizontally. The addColumns determines how many columns that are to be added and the variables, left determines the side of the boardArray where the columns should be added. The variable, placeColVar, is updated according to the number of columns added to the left side of the boardArray. The variable placeColVar is then used centering the drawing of the boardArray
        Parameters:
        addColumns - the number of columns to add
        left - the side to add the columns

      • addRows

        public void addRows(int addRows,
                    boolean top)
        Creates addRows number of rows, create them of the same length as the boardArray. The places the row either at index 0 (if top is true) or at the end of the boardArray if top is false. The variable, placeRowVar, is updated with the number of rows that have been added to the top of the boardArray and used to calculate the placement of the drawing of the boardArray in method draw.
        Parameters:
        addRows - the number of rows to add
        top - the side to add the rows

      • autoFit

        public void autoFit(byte[][] array)
        Fits the boardArray according to array provided as an argument. This is done by calling methods addRows and addColumns which expands the boardArray by 5 at the bottom, right side of the boardArray.
        Specified by:
        autoFit in class Board
        Parameters:
        array - the byte[][] to place onto the boardArray
        See Also:
        addRows(int, boolean), addColumns(int, boolean)

      • beforeSetGeneration

        public void beforeSetGeneration()
        Operations to be performed before setting the next generation. Variables aliveCells, adRow and adCol is set to 0 before processing the next generation. Method addRowsandColumns is called in order to expand the boardArray if necessary and the board containing the number of neighbors is prepared for the next generation. The variable iterations is incremented by 1 to show the number of generations.
        Overrides:
        beforeSetGeneration in class Board
        See Also:
        Board.aliveCells, adRow, adCol, addRowsandColumns(), createNeighBoard(), Board.iterations

      • updateNeighbourBoard

        public void updateNeighbourBoard()
        Iterates over the boardArray in order to update the neighBoard. If the optimaliser is set to true, a tempPair is created in order to contain information about the cells in boardArray which are alive (have value 1). The index is updated with the coordinates of the cells that are alive. The aliveCells is incremented by 1 in order to display the number of alive cells. If the optimaliser has value false, the entire boardArray is iterated in order to detect the alive cells. Regardless of the optimaliser-value, the countNeighbhours method is called in order to count the number of neighbors of the cell at coordinates (row, column).
        Specified by:
        updateNeighbourBoard in class Board
        See Also:
        Board.optimaliser, index, boardArray, Board.aliveCells, countNeighbhours(int, int)

      • createNeighBoard

        public void createNeighBoard()
        Creates an empty byte[][] that is assigned to neighBoard. The neighBoard has the same dimensions as the boardArray.
        Specified by:
        createNeighBoard in class Board
        See Also:
        Board.neighBoard, boardArray

      • countNeighbhours

        public void countNeighbhours(int row,
                             int col)
        Counts the number of neighbors for the cell at coordinate (row, column). The surrounding cells of the cell given by (row, column) are iterated in order to update the number of neighbors that are related to the the current cell with the corresponding cell in neighBoard. The cells that have a cell state of 0 and have neighbors are added to the index with their coordinates (row, column).
        Specified by:
        countNeighbhours in class Board
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the cell
        col - the column of the cell
        See Also:
        Board.neighBoard, boardArray, index

      • setNewGenValues

        public void setNewGenValues()
        Sets the new value of the cells in the boardArray. If the optimaliser is equal to true, the method iterates through index and obtains the row and column from the index, the cell state from the boardArray and the number of neighbors from the neighBoard. The new cell state is determined by the static method in the Rule-class which calculates the new cell state-value. The new cell state-value is placed in the boardArray. If the optimaliser is equal to false, the method iterates over the boardArray and determines the new cell state-value at all the coordinates in the boardArray.
        Specified by:
        setNewGenValues in class Board
        See Also:
        Board.optimaliser, index, boardArray, Board.neighBoard

      • draw

        public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                 CanvasInfo cInfo)
        Draws the cells of the DynamicBoard. The placement values is calculated with the placeColVar and the placeRowVar in order to compensate for columns and rows added to the boardArray. The cells are drawn with a cellSize obtained from the cInfo.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Board
        Parameters:
        gc - the GraphicsContext used to draw
        cInfo - the CanvasInfo-object containing information about the canvas
        See Also:
        placeColVar, placeRowVar, boardArray

      • drawTopBoard

        public void drawTopBoard(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                         CanvasInfo cInfo)
        Draws the topBoard on the canvas. The topBoard to place onto the boardArray is drawn temporarily over the boardArray before being added onto the boardArray. Adjustments to the placement of the topBoard is calculated so that it is placed according to the existing boardArray.
        Specified by:
        drawTopBoard in class Board
        Parameters:
        gc - the GraphicsContext used to draw
        cInfo - the CanvasInfo-object containing information about the canvas
        See Also:
        Board.addArrayToBoard(byte[][])

      • drawStr

        public void drawStr(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                    CanvasInfo cInfo)
        Method that do not position the drawing centered on the canvas. Used for drawing on the horizontal canvas in the editor. Gets the existing gridColor and cellColor and uses these colors to draw the horizontal canvas with the EditorController.
        Parameters:
        gc - the GraphicsContext to use
        cInfo - CanvasInfo object which contains canvas logic
        See Also:
        - the controller for the editor (EditorController)

      • setCellValue

        public void setCellValue(int row,
                         int col,
                         boolean erase,
                         int maxSize)
        Alters the cell state of a specific cell, identified by row and col. The erase determines if the alteration should be 0 into 1 (false) or 1 into 0 (true). If row or col is outside of the bounds of the boardArray, rows or columns are added at the side of the boardArray which is selected.
        Specified by:
        setCellValue in class Board
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the current cell
        col - the column of the current cell
        erase - erases (1 into 0) if true or draws (0 into 1) if false
        maxSize - when the Board will no longer expand on mouseclick.

      • sizeTest

        public void sizeTest()
        Checks if dimensions of the boardArray exceeds a certain limit. If the provided limit (in this case, 2000) is exceeded, the outer rows and columns are set to 0 to limit the dimensions of the boardArray to the given constant (in this case, 2000).
        Specified by:
        sizeTest in class Board
        See Also:
        boardArray

      • aliveCellsTest

        public void aliveCellsTest()
        Sets the outer borders of the boardArray to 0 if the number of alive cells exceeds a constant limit (set to 500 000 in this case).
        See Also:
        boardArray

        Gets the current topBoard.
        Specified by:

        the topBoard

      • setTopBoard

        public void setTopBoard(byte[][] topBoard)
        Sets the given topBoard over the boardArray. The topBoard given as an argument is placed into a temporary byte[][] that is created without the zero-rows and zero-columns of the provided topBoard. The temporary byte[][] is then assigned to the topBoard and then the boardArray is expanded in size in order to fit the topBoard with method autoFit.
        Specified by:
        setTopBoard in class Board
        Parameters:
        topBoard - the byte[][] to set

      • setXmove

        public void setXmove(int xmove)

        Specified by:
        setXmove in class Board
        Parameters:
        xmove - the amount of movement along the X-axis

        setYmove in class Board

      • topExist

      • rotateTopBoard

        public void rotateTopBoard(boolean left)
        Rotates the topBoard. The direction of the rotation is based on the boolean, left and the rotation is performed by creating a temporary byte[][] of equal size to contain the rotated byte[][]. Source: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42519/how-do-you-rotate-a-two-dimensional-array
        Specified by:
        rotateTopBoard in class Board
        Parameters:
        left - the direction of the rotation, true if left
